body.name: Cuisinart TOA-70W AirFryer Oven with Grill,White
body.stockDetail: Only 13 left in stock - order soon.
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
features: COOKING FUNCTIONS: This premium 1800 watt toaster oven and AirFryer, is equipped with AirFry setting plus toast, convection bake, bake, convection broil, broil, grill, warming feature, with a wide temperature range (Warm-450°F)
CAPACITY: Large enough to toast 6-slices of bread, air fry 3-pounds of chicken wings, bake a 12-inch pizza or roast a 4-pound chicken
SUPERIOR OPERATION: Equipped with an adjustable temperature dial, 60-minute timer/auto-shutoff and a toast shade selector to ensure your meals are cooked to your perfection
INCLUDES: Oven light, oven rack, baking pan, AirFry basket, grill and a nonstick easy-clean interior to make cleanup simple
LIMITED 3-YEAR WARRANTY: Refer to user manual for troubleshooting steps and questions surrounding warranty policies
body.description: Cuisinart’s signature AirFryer just got even better! In addition to AirFrying french fries, baking cookies or warming up your leftovers, now you can make even more delicious meals in your Cuisinart® AirFryer Toaster Oven with Grill! Sear steaks and vegetables on one side and griddle the perfect breakfast on the other with the new dual-sided grill and griddle plate. Bring next-generation cooking to your countertop with the spacious 8-function oven that makes cooking a feast for family and friends — or a simple snack for one — fun, fast, and easy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Customer Service, Great Product
reviews.reviewText: The dial switch that enable you to select the mode; Convection Bake, Air Fry etc. broke 10 mos. into use. I really loved this Toaster Oven, and reached out to C.S. Long story short, they sent me the next model up. My new oven also grills. If you want your food fast and save the power needed to preheat your oven, this is for you. It would have been all I needed in college. It can bake a cake, cook a pizza, air fry 30 wings, reheat leftovers. Hate soggy microwave pizza, this is your answer. Just can't say enough. Thank you Cuisinart !

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome functionality, terrible durability
reviews.reviewText: My wife wanted one these for years. I resisted, saying we already had a stove, why do we need another little stove?Dear reader, I was wrong. Turns out this is one of the most useful kitchen appliances I’ve ever bought. Here’s what I like:- Cook times are incredibly short. This thing heats up quick and cooks fast. A 2 lbs bag of cauliflower florets is done in 25 minutes. A frozen pizza that would take 25-28 minutes in the big oven is done in 10-12 minutes.- It’s incredibly helpful to have a second stove when cooking for a crowd.-It’s the summer kitchen I’ve always wanted. It doesn’t heat the house up like the big stove, and if necessary I can plug it in outside so the kitchen is not heated at all.What I don’t like:- Questionable durability. My first one broke in less than a year. The broiler functions stopped working and I was able to return it. I tried a cheaper replacement but it was terrible - slow, uneven cooking. So I got another one of these.This is very basic technology, and if they built it to last I’d have no complaints. Plus, it’d be better for the environment.Overall, though, it’s great. I use it at least four nights a week. If you’re on the fence go ahead and buy it. You won’t regret it.Update April 2021: Bought a replacement on Amazon in July 2020. By April 2021 the function knob failed on the new unit. Waiting to hear back from Cuisinart on a possible replacement, but these are clearly not designed for use in a busy family. They are too expensive to have to replace every 9 to 12 months, and the cost difference between a a cheap selector knob and a quality selector knob can't be more than a few dollars for the volume a large company like Cuisinart is buying. Is doubly disappointing as we typically just leave it on the convect bake feature - the function knob doesn't even see much use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent combo unit
reviews.reviewText: This is my second one of exactly the same model (I have the stainless steel one). I was so happy to find Cuisinart still made the exact same model. Why?? I love everything it can do and the size is perfect. The first one died after 5 years of daily use for everything from toast to air frying. A++ to Cuisinart for a great product. Hope this is still being made if I ever need another because I would buy it again. .

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Cuisinart TOA-70W AirFryer Oven with Grill in White - Looks nice in white. Tired of stainless bc it’s not truly stainless. Finger prints, oil and smudges become difficult to clean off of a stainless surface so i opted for white and it looks great on the counter. Con - the rack tips and slides out so easily that whatever is resting on it can fall right out. Best to use with silicone hot pan holders so you control the rate of slide w/o burning fingers. I did buy an additional easy clean pan that fits the rack for air frying, baking and broiling and it’s heavy so that’s what slides out easily. Pro - air fry’s like a dream in a few short minutes and reheats prepared food like a charm retaining moisture and flavor. Saves energy bc you’re not lighting up the whole oven or microwaving which is not cool. The included cookbook is useful. I would imagine it can be hard to clean the glass over time so regular cleaning would be better than waiting until it gets real dirty.…..its been a few weeks of use and the oven doesn’t heat evenly. The temp is off. Interior Design is not well done and the heating elements doe not distribute heat evenly throughout the oven so burning and under-cooking happens easily. Too bad.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful Addition to Your Kitchen
reviews.reviewText: I have been using this Cuisinart TOA-60 for about several weeks now. My comment is for someone who can not decide whether to buy or not. The following two reasons were why I waited for so long.1. Does the machine gets HOT? This was my big concern. Well, it does get hot, but, nothing dangerously. The best place is where it sits back in the corner of your counter/cupboard.2. Does it make toast? Yes! I replaced my Cuisinart Toaster for this. I bake my own bread and it never tasted this GOOD. The reason for this is; it does not dry out. I start with a slice of frozen bread. Just before it gets golden color, I turn it off, butter it, place it on the plate to keep it warm until the rest of the breakfast is ready. My toast is crispy outside and still moist inside, and I can really taste my homemade bread that I could not taste before using a toaster.For dinner, I used Air Fryer to cook; chicken, pork chop, steak, burger, brats. They all came out great, and FAST. Well, you get the hang of it, you prepare your Air Fryer first whatever you are cooking, (watch youtube ) set the time, while you are getting ready for other things such as setting the table, making salad etc., your Air Fryer is working. When the bell rings your entire dinner is done and serve!I have a tip for cleaning up. For Air Fry, ALWAYS line the pan with aluminum foil to catch the dripping. And, right after cooking, soak the rack in the soapy warm water. By the time you finish your dinner, the rack is cleaned in the soapy water. Also, clean the inside of the machine with soapy wet paper towel each after use. Mine still looking like a brand new. Also, if you are not using the machine for cooking, I use it for warming the plates/rolls. For homemade cookies? just place them for "warm" for 5 min and you get the flaky, just came out of the oven "cookies" every time.I just can not say enough about this Cuisinart TOA-60 that changed my life.I am still learning everyday. I am in my 70's and never thought that my way of cooking was going to change in this way.....

Me ha gustado mucho el producto, fácil de usar y tienes la comida en pocos minutos, hemos preparado bowles, papas, pollo empanizado, pollo crudo marinado, pan tostado. Solo si la bandeja luego considero no es fácil de limpiar se adhiere muy fácil el cochambre aunque lo laves luego luego, pero fuera de eso todo bien.

reviews.reviewTitle: It replaces an older model and I think it is great.
reviews.reviewText: Much easier to clean. Heat is more accurate

reviews.reviewTitle: This has to be the best thing ever invented
reviews.reviewText: I love that I could get rid of my toaster, have convection baking for small items without having to heat up my oven, and air fry for greater health. The appliance is so attractive that I definitely don't mind having it out on display all the time. I am bummed that I had to pay extra to get a white one, when a stainless one would have been cheaper, but ... oh well. The white ones are harder to find, and cost more, and I don't know why.

reviews.reviewTitle: Everything and more worth the purchase.
reviews.reviewText: I love love love my convection oven. I am still getting used to it but I use it everyday from making toast to air fry crispy chicken wings.You do have to be careful with the dials if the time has not run out before your finished just leave the oven door open and the timer will continue to count down. Like the reviews online dont turn the timer dials back by hand because you could snap the dial off. That is a small price to pay for such a great appliance. I read the reviews before I decided on this appliance and it is everything and more happy with my purchase.
